summary: This module provides the default authentication provider configurations, which can be extended to create new authentication providers and functions to interact with the auth:InvocationContext.
description:
Module Overview

This module provides the default authentication provider configurations, which can be extended to create new authentication providers and functions to interact with the auth:InvocationContext.

Invocation Context

The Invocation Context is a data holder, which is created per request and preserved for a single request-response flow. It comprises of auth-related information such as authentication scheme, auth token, and authenticated user's ID, claims, and scopes.

The following code snippet shows how to access the auth:InvocationContext and how to set the data and retrieve them.

Set data to the invocation context.

auth:InvocationContext invocationContext = auth:getInvocationContext();
invocationContext.token = "eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiaWF0IjoxNTE2MjM5MDIyfQ";

Retrieve data from the invocation context.

string? authToken = auth:getInvocationContext()?.token;

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Objects. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the Secured Service with Basic Auth Example and Secured Client with Basic Auth Example.

fields.name: tableName
fields.description: The table name specified in the user-store TOML configuration

records.name: Credential
records.description: Represents the Basic Authentication configurations, which are used by the HTTP endpoint.

returnParameters.description: true if the authentication is successful, false otherwise, or else an auth:Error occurred while authenticating the credentials

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
Attempts to authenticate the base64-encoded username:password credentials.

 boolean|auth:Error authenticationResult = inboundBasicAuthProvider.authenticate("<credential>");

returnParameters.description: true if the authentication is successful, false otherwise, or else an auth:Error occurred while authenticating the credentials

otherMethods.name: authenticate
otherMethods.description:
Attempts to authenticate the base64-encoded username:password credentials.

 boolean|auth:Error authenticationResult = inboundBasicAuthProvider.authenticate("<credential>");

classes.name: InboundBasicAuthProvider
classes.description:
Represents the configuration file based inbound Basic Auth provider, which is an implementation of the auth:InboundAuthProvider interface.

  auth:InboundBasicAuthProvider inboundBasicAuthProvider = new;

A user is denoted by a section in the Ballerina configuration file. The password and the scopes assigned to the user are denoted as keys under the relevant user section as shown below.

 [b7a.users.<username>]
 password="<password>"
 scopes="<comma_separated_scopes>"

returnParameters.description: The generated token or else an auth:Error occurred during the validation

methods.name: generateToken
methods.description:
Generates a token for Basic authentication.

 string|auth:Error token = outboundBasicAuthProvider.generateToken();

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Map of the data, which is extracted from the HTTP response.

returnParameters.description: The token as a string, an auth:Error occurred when generating the token, or else () if nothing is to be returned

methods.name: inspect
methods.description: Inspects the incoming data and generates the token for Basic authentication.

returnParameters.description: The generated token or else an auth:Error occurred during the validation

otherMethods.name: generateToken
otherMethods.description:
Generates a token for Basic authentication.

 string|auth:Error token = outboundBasicAuthProvider.generateToken();

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Map of the data, which is extracted from the HTTP response.

returnParameters.description: The token as a string, an auth:Error occurred when generating the token, or else () if nothing is to be returned

otherMethods.name: inspect
otherMethods.description: Inspects the incoming data and generates the token for Basic authentication.

classes.name: OutboundBasicAuthProvider
classes.description:
Represents the outbound Basic Auth authenticator, which is an implementation of the auth:OutboundAuthProvider interface. This uses the usernames and passwords provided by the Ballerina configurations to authenticate external endpoints.

  auth:OutboundBasicAuthProvider outboundBasicAuthProvider = new({
      username: "tom",
      password: "123"
  });

returnParameters.description: true if the authentication is successful, false otherwise, or else an auth:Error in case of an error

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description: Authenticates the user based on the user credentials (i.e., the username/password) or a token such as JWT or OAuth2.

abstractObjects.name: InboundAuthProvider
abstractObjects.description: Represents the inbound Auth provider, which could be used to authenticate endpoints. The auth:InboundAuthProvider acts as the interface for all the inbound authentication providers. Any type of implementation such as JWT, OAuth2, LDAP, JDBC, file-based etc. should be object-wise similar.

returnParameters.description: The token as a string or else an auth:Error occurred when generating the token

methods.name: generateToken
methods.description: Generates an authentication token for the outbound request with outbound Auth providers such as JWT and OAuth2.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Map of data, which is extracted from the HTTP response

returnParameters.description: The token as a string, an auth:Error occurred when generating the token, or else () if nothing is to be returned

methods.name: inspect
methods.description: Inspects the incoming data and generates the authentication token as needed. For example, if the incoming data indicates that it needs to regenerate the token because the previously-generated token is invalid, this method will generate it.

abstractObjects.name: OutboundAuthProvider
abstractObjects.description: Represents the outbound Auth provider, which could be used to authenticate external endpoints. Any type of implementation such as JWT, OAuth2, LDAP, JDBC, file-based etc. should be object-wise similar to the auth:OutboundAuthProvider object.

returnParameters.description: true if there is a match between the resource and user scopes or else false otherwise

functions.name: checkForScopeMatch
functions.description: Checks whether the scopes of the user match the scopes of the resource.

returnParameters.description: A string tuple with the extracted username and password or else an auth:Error occurred while extracting credentials

functions.name: extractUsernameAndPassword
functions.description:
Extracts the username and the password from the base64-encoded username:password value.

 [string, string]|auth:Error [username, password] = auth:extractUsernameAndPassword("<credential>");

functions.name: getInvocationContext
functions.description:
Returns the auth:InvocationContext instance.

 auth:InvocationContext invocationContext = auth:getInvocationContext();

functions.name: setInvocationContext
functions.description:
Sets the authentication-related values to the invocation context.

 auth:setInvocationContext("jwt", "<credential>", "<userID>", <scopes>, <claims>);

constants.name: DEFAULT_CHARSET
constants.description: Default charset to be used with password hashing.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX
constants.description: Prefix used to denote special configuration values.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA256
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-256 hash.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA384
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-384 hash.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA512
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-512 hash.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BASIC
constants.description: Prefix used to denote Basic Authentication scheme.

constants.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BEARER
constants.description: The prefix used to denote the Bearer Authentication scheme.

errors.name: AuthError
errors.description: Represents the Auth error. This will be returned if an error occurred while inbound auth providers try to authenticate the received credentials and outbound auth providers try to generate the token.
